item.title: Manhattan
item.description: 2 oz rye whiskey1 oz sweet vermouth2 dashes Angostura bitters Combine in a shaker with ice. Stir, then strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a Maraschino cherry.

item.title: Negroni
item.description: The Negroni is my favorite drink. It’s quite sweet, but also bitter and complex. I make mine with Tanquery gin and Cocchi di Torino vermouth. It can also be served on the rocks, but I prefer it neat. 1 oz London dry gin1 oz Campari1 oz Sweet vermouth Add all ingredients to a shaker along with plenty of ice. Stir for 15–20 seconds. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with an orange twist.

item.title: French Kiss
item.description: As always, use only high quality vermouth that is fresh (less than three months old). 2 oz sweet vermouth2 oz dry vermouth Build in a rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
